name: Funk
description: Danceable, syncopated grooves carried by bass and drums alongside percussive guitar, keyboard, and/or horn parts, with rhythmic emphasis on the downbeat.

children.name: Afro-Funk
children.description: Strongly mixed with traditional and more modern genres in sub-Saharan West Africa.

children.name: Britfunk
children.description: Energetic, up-tempo style born out of late-1970s British Jazz-Funk nightclubs.

children.name: Deep Funk
children.description: Focuses more on grooves and rhythm than songwriting.

children.name: Go-Go
children.description: Dominated by drums and percussion (primarily congas) with heavily syncopated rhythms, bursts of horns, and call-and-response vocals.

children.name: Latin Funk
children.description: Funk combined with Hispanic American Music styles.

children.name: P-Funk
children.description: Features a "fat", monotonic drum sound, spaced-out synthesizers, "squelchy" basslines, tight, syncopated horns, and sometimes heavy guitars.

children.name: Porn Groove
children.description: Primarily found in the soundtracks to Pornographic films of the 1970s; characterized by a wah-wah electric guitar sound, slapped basslines, and minimal drums.

children.name: Synth Funk
children.description: Stripped-down and futuristic, driven by synthesizer melodies and often incorporating drum machines.
